titleInfo.title: Letter to William Hornby, President and Governor, Council at Bombay, from John Beaumont and George Green at Bushire

physicalDescription.extent: The item is damaged and has several holes in its text.

mods.abstract: Letter discusses administrative issues and matters related to the sale and trade of woolens. The letter complains of discomfort in the hot season and makes a request for two carpenters to be sent. The letter also states that Bushire's monthly accounts for March and a stock check are enclosed (these items are not contained in the file). Shipped by the Drake.
